title: Error help for ambiguous associated type introduces unstable fixing.

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

labels.name: A-associated-items
labels.description: Area: Associated items such as associated types and consts.

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: D-invalid-suggestion
labels.description: A structured suggestion resulting in incorrect code

body:
<!--
Thank you for filing a bug report! 🐛 Please provide a short summary of the bug,
along with any information you feel relevant to replicating the bug.
-->

I tried this code:

```rust
trait A {
    type Foo;
}

trait B {
    type Foo;
}

trait C: A + B {}

trait D {
    type E: C<Foo = Foo>;
}

struct Foo {}
```

It is true that the trait bound  `C<Foo = Foo>` of associated type `E` in `D` is ambiguous, since supertrait `A` and `B` both have `Foo` associated type.

However, the error report is

```plaintext
error[E0222]: ambiguous associated type `Foo` in bounds of `C`
  --> src/main.rs:12:15
   |
2  |     type Foo;
   |     --------- ambiguous `Foo` from `A`
...
6  |     type Foo;
   |     --------- ambiguous `Foo` from `B`
...
12 |     type E: C<Foo = Foo>;
   |               ^^^^^^^^^ ambiguous associated type `Foo`
   |
   = help: consider introducing a new type parameter `T` and adding `where` constraints:
               where
                   T: C,
                   T: B::Foo = Foo,
                   T: A::Foo = Foo
```

Adding a `where` clause for associated type `E` is unstable, but the error help suggests us to do so.

### Meta
<!--
If you're using the stable version of the compiler, you should also check if the
bug also exists in the beta or nightly versions.
-->

`rustc --version --verbose`:
```
rustc 1.50.0 (cb75ad5db 2021-02-10)
binary: rustc
commit-hash: cb75ad5db02783e8b0222fee363c5f63f7e2cf5b
commit-date: 2021-02-10
host: x86_64-apple-darwin
release: 1.50.0
```
